intro: Findlaya alba, commonly known as the white findlaya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, white, showy flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
